comments.content: You are very correct

Well yes.. but... the question say:
"Which of the following would allow the team to determine the scope of future incidents?"
So application fuzzing will help them determine other potential incidents that could be cause for the coding error.

I would go for fuzzing

Application fuzzing has nothing to do with this type of scenario the basic philosophy of fuzzing is to insert large volume of data and to crash the system delebrately. It is checking how the system can easily be crashed

discussion.content:
"The IT department is unable to identify the specific customers who are affected", it means that the analysts could not understand which information has been exposed and for which customer. For this reason they had to notify the breach to all customers.
Using DB access LOG would help them find out which data has been accessed, in order to address the correct notification to the involved users/customers

Guys , Fuzzing will definitely solve the problem since problem comes from wrong coding which is fine. Problem here is that they know what is going on, but they are unable to see what data is being exposed. Question asks " Which of the following would allow the team to determine the scope of future incidents? " meaning what should we do to track if someone else PHI leaks - > Monitor DB access which makes most sense with regards to what the questions asks. I read it 10 times and initially thought Fuzzing as well, but I believe given answer is correct.
We want to know the scope, not to fix the error . Answer is correct

Yes B
Database activity monitoring (DAM) is the process of observing, identifying and reporting a database's activities. Database activity monitoring tools use real-time security technology to monitor and analyze configured activities independently and without relying on the DBMS auditing or logs.

These tools also help in detecting unusual and unauthorized, internal or external activities while still gauging the effectiveness of security tools and policies in place. In so doing, system administrators are able to improve the prevention and protection of sensitive data from intruders.

There is NOT a single mention of SQL or any other DATABASE engine! The data could be stored in flat files... 

PREVENT CODE ERRORS = FUZZING
The given answer is correct. Databas Access Monitoring allows to identify or predict issues

Given answer is correct in my opinion, look at the question "Which of the following would allow the team to determine the scope of future incidents? " it is asking for the scope of the future incidents, it DOES NOT ask about how can you secure your application in future, fuzzing will help you determine vulnerability in testing phase but that's not the case, the question is looking for the scope, so database log will shows that what data was accessed and how many customer's data have been breached, that shows the scope.

comments.content:
fuzzing is used to test the code, however the question is asking how to know the scope of the data breach.
it never asked you to test the web app but instead it asked what is the scope of the data breach in which you can get from database logs.

discussion.content: coding error... fuzzing

This question makes no sense. What's an "incorrect organization" and also, PHI data by itself means that it can be traced back to individuals, because data is only considered PHI (Protected Health Information) when an individual could be identified from the information.

comments.content: B would help identify what DB entries got accessed, so they would be able to tell how many and which customers are affected by future data leaks.

What I'm reading here is there are coding errors that leak data when a query is made. The SCOPE of FUTURE INCIDENTS could potentially be revealed by application fuzzing to see what other code errors could leak information and what other code needs to be fixed. 

I'm not sure how B would help determine the scope of future incidents.

questions.question_text:
A coding error has been discovered on a customer-facing website. The error causes each request to return confidential PHI data for the incorrect organization.
The IT department is unable to identify the specific customers who are affected. As a result, all customers must be notified of the potential breach. Which of the following would allow the team to determine the scope of future incidents?

discussion.content:
Private cloud reduced latency.
SaaS = pay-as-you-go - this probably equates to "measure at devices"... Not sure.
Answers seems to be correct.. However, fog computing significantly reduces latency, but it is not a part of the compTIA official book :)
So really not sure, guys...

SaaS, IaaS, and PaaS can all have pay as you go implemented...it is not specific to SaaS

Fog Computing because the question is a direct copy from the purpose of why Fog (Edge) Computing was set up by industry consortium. as pointed out in the wiki link by shpunk.

I like B and F. But A/C can also be viable answers. Like Babati said... not sure. lol.. I used the following articles: https://www.netapp.com/knowledge-center/what-is-cloud-analytics/
https://www.sam-solutions.com/blog/fog-computing-vs-cloud-computing-for-iot-projects/

This is almost a word by word definition of fog computing. REFERENCE: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fog_computing

comments.content: Since the architecture must contain some network connected devices, the only two viable answers are Hybrid Cloud and Fog Computing.

questions.question_text: A systems engineer is setting up a RADIUS server to support a wireless network that uses certificate authentication. Which of the following protocols must be supported by both the RADIUS server and the WAPs?

comments.content:
Not the only one.
CCMP—Counter Mode with Cipher Block Chaining Message Authentication
Code Protocol. 
WPA2 supports CCMP, which is based on AES and is much stronger
than WPA using TKIP.

discussion.content: EAP Is the only authentication protocol out of the list

Generally with RADIUS, it must check which authentication scheme is in place such as CHAP or EAP when the clients try to connect. CCMP is actually a wireless protocol. It is used to address the vulnerabilities of TKIP and is used with WPA2. You have to also remember it meets the IEEE 802.11i and use a 128-bit key size.

The RADIUS client prompts the user for their authentication details,
such as a username and password or digital certificate. Certificatebased
authentication is available if the RADIUS product supports EAP.

questions.question_text:
A small retail business has a local store and a newly established and growing online storefront. A recent storm caused a power outage to the business and the local ISP, resulting in several hours of lost sales and delayed order processing. The business owner now needs to ensure two things:
✑ Protection from power outages
✑ Always-available connectivity in case of an outage
The owner has decided to implement battery backups for the computer equipment. Which of the following would BEST fulfill the owner's second need?

discussion.content:
C.
Purchase services from a cloud provider for high availability.

Read it again if the owner transfers everything to a reliable High-Availability data center, he won't have to worry about buying infrastructure or backup internet connection. So he can simply store everything with a reliable Cloud provider 

So, C is correct
I think A. POTS as backup
Terrible question to only select 1. Power outage will shut down all devices requiring power. UPS will help with power issues. First choice B

comments.content: Disregard: The owner has decided to implement battery backups for the computer equipment. missed that part. Sorry

The online store will continue to function whether you locally lose your ISP connection for customers to place order. There might be a delay in order processing, but you won't lose business as long as you can justify the delay. Case in point, is the current Covid situation, where all Amazon order placements comes with a message of "delayed processing because of restrictions".

discussion.content: how do i connect to 99.99% SLA Cloud without internet access?

comments.content: Battery backup for outage for both small business and ISP. Online storefront still serves the need to customer for ordering if the services are in cloud - always available.
Cloud Services can provide % 99,999 SLA for availability
Does AWS or Azure rely on your local ISP?
Agreed

discussion.content: Not sure how C would help if the local ISP also experienced an outage as the question states. Answer should be A imo.

choices.A: Lease a telecommunications line to provide POTS for dial-up access.
choices.D: Replace the business's wired network with a wireless network.
choices.C: Purchase services from a cloud provider for high availability.
choices.B: Connect the business router to its own dedicated UPS.

discussion.content:
EAP-TLS
EAP-TLS is currently considered the strongest type of authentication and is very
widely supported. An encrypted Transport Layer Security (TLS) tunnel is established
between the supplicant and authentication server using public key certificates on the
authentication server and supplicant. As both supplicant and server are configured
with certificates, this provides mutual authentication. The supplicant will typically
provide a certificate using a smart card or a certificate could be installed on the client
PC, possibly in a Trusted Platform Module (TPM).

If questions relating to these terms confuse you, take 5 min to read the wiki

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extensible_Authentication_Protocol

comments.content: jk I read it and honestly still don't quite understand why we need these
ONLY EAP-TLS does certs for client and server

discussion.content:
Keywords: Mutual Authentication of the client and the server, PKI.
EAP-TLS requires a certificate for the server and the client's so yes answer is EAP-TLS.

EAP-TLS which is a certificate based system that provides MUTUAL authentication. It's not practical to use in enterprise scenarios because it needs to be configured and managed on both the client and server side.

Since mutual authentication is required, is the correct answer not supposed to be EAP-TTLS?
Someone should please clarify

comments.content: EAP-TTLS Authenticates clients using ONLY server-side certificates. The question mentions that mutual authentication of the client and the server must be used. EAP-TLS Relies on client-side and server-side certificates to perform authentication.
